bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding bonds and conditions of release imposed to assure the appearance of a defendant.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding bonds and conditions of release imposed to assure the appearance of a defendant. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-22-1 be amended to read as follows: 58-22-1. The following words when Terms used in this chapter shall have the following meanings mean : (1) "Bail bond," an appearance bond in a specified amount executed by the deposit of cash with the clerk of the court, or executed by a licensed property bondsperson, surety bondsperson, or professional bondsperson, guaranteeing only the defendant's appearance at scheduled court appearances; (2) "Bail bond forfeiture," the order forfeiting an appearance bond executed for a defendant who fails to appear for a scheduled court hearing; (3) "Bail bondsman bondsperson, " shall mean a surety bondsman bondsperson , professional bondsman bondsperson, or a licensed property bondsman as hereinafter defined. bondsperson; (2) (4) "Insurer , " shall mean any domestic, foreign , or alien surety company which has qualified generally to transact surety business and specifically to transact bail bond business in this state . ; (3) (5) "Professional bondsman bondsperson, " shall mean any person who has been approved by the director and who pledges cash or approved unregistered bonds as security for a bail bond in connection with a judicial proceeding and receives or is promised money or other things of value . ; (4) (6) "Property bondsman bondsperson, " is a person who pledges real or other property as security for a bail bond in a judicial proceeding and who receives or is promised money or other things of value therefor . ; (7) "Revocation of release," the order revoking a defendant's release for violation of any condition of release set by the court; (5) (8) "Runner , " shall mean a person employed by a bail bondsman bondsperson for the purpose of assisting the bail bondsman bondsperson in presenting the defendant in court when required or to assist assisting in apprehension and surrender of the defendant to the court, or keeping the defendant under necessary surveillance. This does not affect the right of a bail bondsman bondsperson to hire counsel or to ask assistance of law enforcement officers . ; (6) (9) "Surety bondsman bondsperson, " shall mean any person who has been approved by the director and appointed by an insurer by power of attorney to execute or countersign bail bonds for the insurer in connection with judicial proceedings and who receives or is promised money or other things of value therefor. Section 2. Upon a showing that there has been a failure to make a required appearance for a scheduled court hearing without good cause, the court may issue an order forfeiting an appearance bond. If the defendant is not in custody, the court shall direct the clerk to issue a warrant for the defendant's arrest. Upon the performance of the appearance bond, the deposit shall be returned. Section 3. That § 23A-43-3 be amended to read as follows: 23A-43-3. When If a determination is made that a release pursuant to § 23A-43-2 will does not reasonably assure the appearance of the defendant as required, the committing magistrate or court shall, either in lieu of or in addition to the methods of release described in § 23A-43-2, impose the first any of the following conditions of release which will reasonably assure the appearance of the defendant for trial or, if no single condition gives that assurance, any combination of the following conditions : (1) Place the defendant in the custody of a designated person or organization agreeing to supervise him the defendant ; (2) Place restrictions on the travel, association, or place of abode of the defendant during the period of release; (3) Require an appearance bond in a specified amount . The bond shall be executed by depositing with the clerk of the court, in cash or other security, as directed, a sum not to exceed ten percent of the amount of the bond. The deposit shall be returned upon the performance of the conditions of release , which may either be executed by the deposit of cash with the clerk of the court, or by execution of an appearance bond by a licensed property bondsperson, surety bondsperson, or professional bondsperson ; or (4) Require the execution of a bail bond with sufficient solvent sureties, or the deposit of cash in lieu of a bail bond; or (5) Impose any other condition reasonably necessary to assure the defendant's appearance as required, including a condition requiring that the defendant return to custody after specified hours. Section 4. That § 23A-43-21 be amended to read as follows: 23A-43-21. Upon a showing that there has been a material breach of a condition of release without good cause, the court shall declare a forfeiture of the bond, if any, revocation of the defendant's release and shall enter an order revoking the conditions of release. If the defendant is not in custody, the court shall direct the clerk to issue a warrant for the defendant's arrest. The defendant shall remain in custody until discharged by due course of law.
